thread.title: HP cutting more jobs in Houston
thread.title_full: HP cutting more jobs in Houston

author: Olivia Pulsinelli
title: HP cutting more jobs in Houston
text: Bloomberg Meg Whitman is CEO of Hewlett-Packard Co. (NYSE: HPQ), which recently notified the Texasâ€¦ more Hewlett-Packard Co. (NYSE: HPQ) recently notified the Texas Workforce Commission that it has been cutting additional jobs in Houston. The latest job cuts occurred on May 29 and July 3, and the next rounds were planned for Aug. 28 and Sept. 4, according to the Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification Act letter sent to the TWC on Aug. 27. In total, 70 jobs will be cut. However, some of the affected employees could "find a new position elsewhere within the company and/or transfer to another HP facility," the letter reads. Each affected employee will be given an equivalent of 60 days of pay and benefits. The employees are not represented by a union, and they do not have bumping rights, meaning employees with more seniority whose jobs are eliminated cannot take the jobs of less-senior employees. These cuts are in addition to the 77 jobs cut earlier this year and the 66 announced in November . As with those instances, HP said the latest cuts were due to further corporate restructuring at its 11445 Compaq Center Drive W. location.
